item.description:
Buonasera a tutti


On Sunday, April 29th I will host 3 different events in the North End...(**this is a slight change from the original plan**)


Anyone that is reading this information can attend all 3 of these events for a total of $40....the only thing that I ask, is that if you attend all 3 events, then you order at least a coffee/tea at Caffe Paradiso. This allows me to continue to utilize the function room for these events and keeps the manager happy.


If you wish to attend only 2 of these events, the cost will still be $40, and you must attend at least the lunch at Saraceno. If this is the case, I ask that you notify me whether you want to attend either EVENT 1 + 2 (wine and dine) or EVENT 2 + 3 (dine and movie). If you attend EVENT 2 + 3, then you will receive a free coffee/tea and a biscotto at Caffè Paradiso.


The total number of persons I can host for these events are the following:


Wine Tasting at the Wine Bottega - 25 persons

Lunch at Saraceno - 35 persons

Movie at Caffe Paradiso - 25 persons


As of this evening (April 21) there are approximately 10 spots open for the wine tasting and about 12 for the movie. I can take about 20 more people for the lunch at Saraceno. Priority goes to present Italian students in this program, followed by former students, followed by everyone else receiving this.

These are not Italian-only speaking events. Even though some of the attendees are Italian and many of the students that attend are learning Italian, guests should not feel at a disadvantage if they are not at a comfortable Italian speaking level. The movie we will be watching is shown in Italian with English Subtitles.

These events are a lot of fun, and there is always a lot of good conversation among interesting people.


If you are driving in....parking is FREE and unlimited in the North End on Sundays until 6:00 pm...


Here are the details of the events:


EVENT #1 - (12:30-1:30pm) - Private Wine Tasting Party w/ hors d'oeuvres @ the Wine Bottega (341 Hanover Street) *http://thewinebottega.com/http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-wine-bottega-boston

*hors d'oeuvres include: salami, cheese, veges, bread sticks, nuts


EVENT #2 - (1:45-3:15pm) - 3-course Family-style Lunch @ Ristorante Saraceno (286 Hanover Street) **http://www.saracenos.com/http://www.tripadvisor.com/Restaurant_Review-g60745-d322156-Reviews-Ristorante_Saraceno-Boston_Massachusetts.htmlThe details of the family-style meal are still being worked out, but most likely will include a mixture or limited to the following:

ANTIPASTO - Insalata Caprese (tomato/mozzarella) ; Insalata della casa ; Assorted meats and veges

PRIMO - Spaghetti all'amatriciana ; Gnocchi Napoletana ; Spaghetti Marinara ; Tagliatelle alla Bolognese

SECONDO - Chicken Marsala ; Chicken in White Wine ; Chicken Cacciatore

CONTORNO - Roasted potatoes and a vegetable

**drinks are not included


EVENT #3 - (3:30-5:00) - Showing of the Italian movie 'Non è ancora domani' (La pivellina)' - ('Little girl') on the BIG screen @ Caffè Paradiso (255 Hanover Street)

http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1426371/reviews

This film was the TOP prize getter in 2010 for all Italian films according to the following website http://www.cinemaitaliano.info... see link below:http://www.cinemaitaliano.info/piupremiati/annouscita/2010.html

***coffee/tea/espresso and biscotto are included for those attending only Events 2 and 3

TOTAL PRICE IS $40 payable by cash or check upon arrival on Sunday, April 29th. Credit card payment is also an option....call me for the details on how to use PayPal on my website.


Contact me asap if you have any other questions about parking, directions or anything else....

John JordanLanguage, Travel and Culture Exchange, LLC

(617) 233-9876 | jjordan@italianprogram.com

http://italianprogram.com
